articles.title: Iran may give China the world's largest gas field due to U.S. sanctions
articles.description: Iran has given French company Total two months to obtain exemptions from U.S. sanctions, or else China gets its share of the South Pars gas field.

articles.title: Sarah Sanders choked up after a boy asked what the White House will do to keep him safe at school
articles.description: “I think that as a kid and certainly as parent, there is nothing that could be more terrifying than for a kid to go to school and not feel safe,” Sanders said.

articles.title: Avenatti has to end "publicity tour" if he wants a part in Michael Cohen case
articles.description: The judge questioned if Avenatti's media appearances could sway a jury against the president's former lawyer.

articles.title: Mike Pompeo urges right-wing Hungary to counter Russia's malign influence in Europe
articles.description: The secretary of state's entreaties will likely be ignored.

articles.title: Is the Deep State real? Former intelligence officials say it's complete nonsense
articles.description: The president's attacks on the U.S. intelligence community have cast CIA and FBI leaders into the unprecedented role of public “truth tellers.”

articles.title: Reports that hundreds of undocumented children are "lost" are "completely false," an HHS official says
articles.description: "This is a classic example of the adage 'No good deed goes unpunished,'" Health and Human Services Deputy Secretary Eric Hargan said.

articles.author: Jessica Wapner
articles.title: The opioid epidemic has a strange consequence: more organs for transplantation
articles.description: Researchers who noticed an increase in the number of organs available traced the change back to a disconcerting source.

articles.title: Betsy DeVos greeted by a teen wearing a transgender pride flag during school visit
articles.description: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos has rolled back protections for transgender students.
